metadata.Title: CVE-2018-15854 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unchecked NULL pointer usage in xkbcommon before 0.8.1 could be used by local attackers to crash (NULL pointer dereference) the xkbcommon parser by supplying a crafted keymap file, because geometry tokens were desupported incorrectly.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-15854` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libxkbcommon-x11-0 - 0.4.1-0ubuntu1.1
libxkbcommon0 - 0.4.1-0ubuntu1.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libxkbcommon package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.4.1-0ubuntu1.1').
